Sentencas: Progress in solid fuel utilization in fuel cells relies on devising effective delivery mechanisms for solid fuel and oxygen to the electrochemical reaction site.
Titulo: Mechanistic Modes for Solid Carbon Conversion in High Temperature Fuel Cells

Sentencas: This paper provides a mechanistic overview of the different delivery modes and vehicles that have been adopted for engaging solid fuel and oxygen at the electrochemical interface to achieve efficient oxidation of carbon.
Titulo: Mechanistic Modes for Solid Carbon Conversion in High Temperature Fuel Cells

Sentencas: Also, a CO shuttle mechanism is proposed to explain the operation and behavior of several direct carbon fuel cell (DCFC) approaches in CO(2) or inert environments.
Titulo: Mechanistic Modes for Solid Carbon Conversion in High Temperature Fuel Cells

Sentencas: This paper also introduces the operating principle and experimental results of a concept: the fluidized bed (FB) DCFC.
Titulo: Mechanistic Modes for Solid Carbon Conversion in High Temperature Fuel Cells

Sentencas: It consists of a solid oxide fuel cell arrangement coupled to a Boudouard-type FB dry gasifier.
Titulo: Mechanistic Modes for Solid Carbon Conversion in High Temperature Fuel Cells

Sentencas: A maximum power density of 175 mW/cm(2) (or 4 W) was achieved at 850 degrees C for the conversion of activated carbon in this FB-DCFC arrangement.
Titulo: Mechanistic Modes for Solid Carbon Conversion in High Temperature Fuel Cells
